intro: Androsace congesta, commonly known as the clustered androsace, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant has a mat-forming habit with hairy stems and leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Androsace congesta is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
